meanings.definition: To make a signal or signals.
meanings.sent1: She was signalizing to her friend across the room.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse was signalizing ships to warn them of the rocky shore.
meanings.sent3: The cat was signalizing to its owner that it wanted to play by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors of the flowers signalized the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks signalized the start of the celebration.

meanings.definition: To communicate or indicate by or as if by signals.
meanings.sent1: The traffic lights were signalizing drivers to stop.
meanings.sent2: He was signalizing his approval by nodding his head.
meanings.sent3: The dog was signalizing its hunger by wagging its tail eagerly.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds signalized an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher signalized the correct answer by giving a thumbs up.
